topic.title: Restoring design documents
topic.shortdesc: Design documents are restored using the design_doc_only=1 option.

section.title: Using cbrestore for design documents
section.p: Design documents are restored to a server node with the option, design_doc_only=1. You restore the documents from a backup file (create with cbbackup).

codeblock.codeph:
> ./cbrestore ~/backup http://10.3.1.10:8091 -x design_doc_only=1 -b a_bucket -B my_bucket
transfer design doc only. bucket msgs will be skipped. done

section.p: This will restore design documents from the backup file ~/backup/a_bucket to the destination bucket my_bucket in a cluster. If you backed up more than one source bucket, you will need to perform this command more than once. For instance, imagine you did a backup for a cluster with two data buckets and have the backup files ~/backup/bucket_one/design.json and ~/backup/bucket_two/design.json :

codeblock.codeph:
> ./cbrestore ~/backup http://10.3.1.10:8091 -x design_doc_only=1 -b bucket_one -B my_bucket
> ./cbrestore ~/backup http://10.3.1.10:8091 -x design_doc_only=1 -b bucket_two -B my_bucket

section.p: This restores design documents in both backup files to a bucket in your cluster named my_bucket After you restore the design documents you can see them in Couchbase Web Console under the Views tab.
